The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.

Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Meghna Krishnadas  Meghna was extremely accessible, knowledgeable, and eager to help students with key concepts. Additionally, she provided numerous resources which provide more practical application of the course material than the main text.
Instructor: Meghna Krishnadas  In office hours, Meghna was extremely helpful and patient in explaining the course concepts. Grading of assignments could be more efficient, however.

Instructor: Meghna Krishnadas  Strengths - she is very knowledgable and seemed to clearly care about our learning, even following up with me after TA sessions with new reports she'd found. Weaknesses - she was not great at being responsive and grading materials in a timely manner.
Instructor: Meghna Krishnadas  Meghna was very helpful, she was always available and explained concepts clearly.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This was a great class- I really enjoyed it and learned a lot of practical, applicable skills in statistical analysis.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Homework assignments were well designed and provided a learning experience as well as a test of mastery of course concepts
Not only you got know how to do basic codeing, but also you are expected to know the statistic discipline behind R.

Tim gave very clear explanations of the material, and the course was very well organized-- it was clear from the beginning what we were going to cover and how topics were related to one another. The availability of well organized data sets and example scripts was very helpful.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Perhaps more interactive lectures!
Textbook was incredibly inaccessible. Prof. Gregoire's lecture notes are very good but his style of lecture is somewhat dry.
I hope the TA could provide more workshops for us

It would have been helpful to start each week (or even each course!) with a "table of contents" style overview: this is where we are, and this is how this concepts relates to what we have done in the past and what we will do in the future. Also, it would be helpful to have a way to view the PDF lecture notes in a lit classroom-- the dark classroom sometimes made it hard to pay attention!

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Regression analysis is an important tool.
It fits well with my master thesis

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Important professional skill.
I took this course due to my original interests.
To gain proficiency in regression analysis and R

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
absolutely. I feel much more confident in doing regression, and more generally in collecting and analyzing data.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take advantage of the homeworks as a learning opportunity, go to TA office hours as they are very worthwhile for clarification
Its better to take if you had statistical background before.
This is a great course for anyone who wants to get better at statistical analysis, regression for ecological/environmental data, and the software R. Would highly recommend.
